data.description:
Steam Link streams the games you love in your Steam library directly from your computer to your Meta Quest headset. Using the power of your computer, it delivers a high-fidelity and intuitive way to wirelessly play your favorite games, discuss them with your friends, and access your desktop apps.

To get started, download and install Steam Link onto your headset. It will walk you through wirelessly connecting to your computer located on the same network as your headset with Steam installed and running.

Install the Steam Link app today to experience Steam - the ultimate destination for playing, discussing, and creating games.

Minimum Requirements
  •	A computer running Steam and SteamVR
  •	Supported OS: Windows 10 or newer
  •	Computer GPUs: NVIDIA (GTX970 or better)
  •	Wireless Router: 5GHz Channel, Wi-Fi 5
  •	Headset: Meta Quest 2, 3, or Pro

Recommended
  •	Computer Processor: Intel Core i5-4590/AMD FX 8350 equivalent or better
  •	Computer Memory: 16 GB RAM
  •	Computer GPUs: NVIDIA (RTX2070 or better)
  •	Network: Broadband Internet connection
  •	Wireless Router: Wi-Fi 6 or Wi-Fi 6E
  •	Computer using wired network connection

changelog.change_log: * Disabled 2D mode in preparation to release to public from beta * Override default for transport to current SteamVR Beta Transport * Fix crash that could happen when stopping the stream, which would prevent the 2D panel from displaying * Changed behavior of stream startup so interstitials are only shown after a timeout if the stream hasn't started * Reduce amount information that the headset needs to send to the PC * Fix WiFi always showing up as 2.4GHz * Allow launching with hand tracking on (Does not include hand tracking support) * Fixes possible audio crash on standby * Fix bug that caused incorrect controller presence reporting when switching to volume-buttons-as-steam-button feature.

* Fix crash when coming out of standby
* Fix issue preventing initialization if certain packets get dropped.
* "Waiting for host" screen will now wait before displaying, meaning app will transition straight to stream rather than the UI displaying
* Add additional errors to display if it's a video code error/video network error
* Small improvements to stream startup speed
* Fix a few bugs around stream transitions to UI
* Fix microstutter (From previous beta)

* Fix crash that can happen in specific pause/resume situations 
 * Fix initialization code, that will be able to prevent deadlocking in some situations (but will require a SteamVR Beta Update that will be available after this goes live)
This update will pair with SteamVR 2.5 to resolve additional failure-to-stream issues.

* Resolved issue preventing host activation in some obscure situations that would result in an error 200, when network data was flowing.
* Resolved a crash that happens when headset goes into standby.

The Steam Link 2.0.5.705 update is required for compatibility with the recent Meta Quest OS v63 updates. 

- Resolve crash when hovering over in-headset alerts on v63
- Resolve occasional crash when entering/exiting standby
- For Sim/Hybrid users: When used with SteamVR Beta 2.4.1, and no controllers are enabled, allow volume buttons on headset to navigate the host PC dashboard
- Improve international language support
